channel.title: "name" has logged in
channel.description: ok guys im running 317 and i believe its delta source and i wanted to know how can i make it so that when somebody logs in it says "so and so" has logged in, and i dont want to it to be for only staff but any regular member also. I tried i compiled and everything but it wont say it lol i took it off a altarscape though maybe thats why. any help please? also if you could tell me where to add it. i know client.java but where in there

item.title: "name" has logged in
item.dc:creator: @chippeh chippeh
item.description:
@chippeh wrote:

Look for the logout method and pretty much the same code there for the logout message :o

Read full topic

item.title: "name" has logged in
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“Mr. Despair, post:2, topic:337719”]This is something I just made up, try it.

Put

yell("" + playerName + " has logged in.") && playerRights > 0;

Under

public void initialize() {

Public void initialize so when the player logs in, the code you put in under it will be recognized and started.
PM me if it didn’t work or you’re getting errors.[/quote]

Stole the words right out of my mouth XD

Read full topic

item.title: "name" has logged in
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“iamapker, post:5, topic:337719”]wow thats gonna say it when people log in lol not easy[/quote]No it will say that too, or there may be another process behind it.

}
if (playerRights == 0) &&playerLoggedOut {
yell("The player +P.Name+ has logged out, awww :c.");
}

that’s the way my server code is, it’s sort of like a renamed client.

Read full topic

item.title: "name" has logged in
item.dc:creator: @iamapker iamapker
item.description:
@iamapker wrote:

i tried it different way, i put this under my welcome message it worked fine

} if (playerRights == 0) { yell(""+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); }

now i am looking for a way to make it say when someone logs out lol and ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: "name" has logged in
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

This is something I just made up, try it.

Put

yell("" + playerName + " has logged in.") && playerRights > 0;

Under

public void initialize() {

Public void initialize so when the player logs in, the code you put in under it will be recognized and started.
PM me if it didn’t work or you’re getting errors.

Read full topic
